1.title: Nature Wellness
1.shortDescription: Flagship program to reveal the essence and performance of your wellness center or spa
1.fullDescription: Discover our flagship program 'Nature & Wellness Consulting', designed to reveal the essence and performance of your wellness center or spa through medicinal and aromatic plants and sustainable knowledge from Madagascar. Inspired by the island's exceptional biodiversity, this program transforms wellness spaces into immersive, sensory, and regenerative experiences, aligned with global holistic trends.
features: Initial diagnosis and audit of your facilities
Architectural optimization of spaces - signature ambiance
benefits: Innovative modernization of your services with natural care
Reassuring and attractive environment for your clients
Integration of regenerative therapies and natural products
Profitability boost and attraction of new niches
Promotion of holistic health and reduced environmental impact

Complete management: logistics, nature-inspired scenography, animation
Hybrid option: online broadcasting and interactive webinars
Detailed event plan and post-event follow-up
benefits: Post-event impact report with feedback and generated leads

5.fullDescription: Integrate Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) for positive impact on environment and society. We accompany you in implementing concrete CSR strategies adapted to the Malagasy context, from energy optimization to community development.

felana.name: Felana Anna RAMAHANDRISON
felana.description: With solid experience in event organization and institutional communication, she excels in connecting public and private partners. Graduated in Sustainable Tourism Management and Communication & Marketing, she has managed more than 15 major events, fostering effective collaborations. Specialist in hybrid campaigns, she focuses on inclusion, social impact and promoting sustainable development.
felana.mobileDescription: Visionary entrepreneur and founder of Vina Consulting, Felana Anna brings her expertise in business strategy and digital innovation. Passionate about sustainable economic development, she transforms challenges into opportunities.

holiniaina.name: Holiniana Norohariliva RAKOTOMALALA
holiniaina.description: She enhances Malagasy biodiversity through her expertise in chemical processes, cosmetic formulation and sustainable management of natural resources. With over 15 years of experience and training in applied chemistry, she designs conferences adapted to local and international issues. Supported by a network of experts, she develops eco-responsible formulations based on biotherapeutic active ingredients and essential oils, combining ecosystem protection and value creation for communities.
holiniaina.mobileDescription: Founder of Ikolo, a company specialized in cosmetic and medicinal products based on Malagasy plants. Entrepreneur committed to the valorization of natural resources and well-being through plants.

hero.title: Our Articles
hero.subtitle: Discover the key events that have shaped our expertise in organizing and coordinating exceptional events.

0.title: HOLINIAINA RAKOTOMALALA NOROHARILIVA: A SYNERGY ARCHITECT AT THE HEART OF THE INTERNATIONAL ECONOMIC ACTORS FAIR
0.excerpt: Central role in the design, coordination and outreach of SIAE 2022-2023 as Director of External Relations and General Coordinator.
0.content:
Since its creation, the International Economic Actors Fair (SIAE) has established itself as an essential platform for meetings, reflection and collaboration between the driving forces of the Malagasy economy. During its first two editions ‚Äî in 2022 and 2023 ‚Äî Holiniaina Rakotomalala Norohariliva, founder of IKOLO, played a central role in the design, coordination and outreach of this major event, both nationally and internationally.

üéØ **Strategic leadership serving openness**
As Director of External Relations of SIAE for both editions, Holiniaina orchestrated the institutional, diplomatic and sectoral links that allowed the fair to anchor itself in national and regional dynamics. Thanks to her keen sense of diplomacy and her ability to value local talents, she positioned SIAE as a convergence space between public, private and international actors.

üß© **Rigorous and inclusive coordination**
In parallel, she assumed the function of General Coordinator of the organization, ensuring logistical coherence, schedule fluidity and active partner involvement. Her inclusive approach mobilized a diversity of economic actors ‚Äî entrepreneurs, institutions, cooperatives, donors ‚Äî around a shared vision: that of a Malagasy economy rebuilt by its own forces.

üì£ **High-impact communication strategy**
Holiniaina also supervised the fair's communication strategy, highlighting the values of innovation, collaboration and valorization of local initiatives. Through sensitive and strategic storytelling, she managed to radiate SIAE far beyond the fair's walls, in the media, social networks and influence circles.

ü§ù **An ambassador of economic networking**
Finally, as organizer of B2B meetings, workshops and SIAE ambassador, she created bridges between entrepreneurs, investors and institutions. These meetings generated concrete opportunities for partnership, funding and growth for many project holders.

1.title: INIM: CONGRESS ON THE VALORIZATION OF PLANT RAW MATERIALS
1.excerpt: Coordination of INIM Congress 2022-2023 to valorize Malagasy natural ingredients in health, cosmetic and food sectors.
1.content:
üåø **INIM: CONGRESS ON THE VALORIZATION OF PLANT RAW MATERIALS FROM MALAGASY LANDS AND THE VALORIZATION OF THEIR NATIONAL AND INTERNATIONAL COMMERCIAL EXCHANGES**

The INIM Congress ‚Äì Innovative Natural Ingredients Madagascar established itself, from its first two editions in 2022 and 2023, as an essential meeting for actors in the valorization of Malagasy natural ingredients (in the health, aromatherapy, cosmetics, food and bio-construction sectors). At the crossroads of biodiversity, research, entrepreneurship and sustainable development, this event brought together economic operators, institutions, donors and experts around a common ambition: to make Madagascar a regional leader in botanical innovation and responsible transformation.

ü§ù **Female coordination serving impact**
At the heart of this dynamic, Anna and Holy, two visionary entrepreneurs had the opportunity to carry the congress with rigor, creativity and commitment:

‚Ä¢ **Anna**, founder of Vina Consulting, ensured the overall coordination of the project, piloting the multi-channel communication strategy with institutional partners, PTF and economic operators. From logistical preparation to technical team mobilization, through webinar organization, supplier management and final report elaboration, she orchestrated each edition with remarkable precision.

‚Ä¢ **Holy Rakotomalala**, founder of IKOLO, being an expert in natural resource valorization, assumed the role of innovation manager and panelist manager. She designed thematic content, selected speakers, ensured panel monitoring-evaluation, and ensured that each speech contributed to a coherent and inspiring vision of natural innovation in Madagascar.

üå± **A congress serving transformation**
The two editions of the INIM Congress allowed:
‚Ä¢ To valorize local sectors: essential oils, plant extracts, cosmetic actives and nutraceuticals
‚Ä¢ To connect producers to international markets
‚Ä¢ To promote public-private partnerships to structure value chains
‚Ä¢ To raise awareness about traceability, quality and ethics in natural resource exploitation

Through a rich program of panels, workshops, exhibitions and B2B meetings, the congress laid the foundations for an innovation ecosystem rooted in Malagasy biodiversity and open to the world.

2.title: DESIGN THINKING: COLLABORATIVE IMMERSION BETWEEN 2M CONSULTING, IKOLO AND VINA
2.excerpt: Collaborative workshop on February 8, 2025 bringing together entrepreneurs to design innovative products adapted to client needs.
2.content:
üåø **Design Thinking Workshop: a collaborative immersion between 2M Consulting, IKOLO and VINA**

Last February 8, about twenty entrepreneurs gathered for a day of immersion in product Design Thinking, organized by 2M Consulting in partnership with the Business Support Department of CCIA. This workshop, under the sign of collaborative innovation, allowed participants to appropriate Design Thinking tools to design or improve their products in line with the real needs of their clients.

For **Holy Rakotomalala**, founder of IKOLO, this day had particular resonance. After more than a year of active consultancy within 2M Consulting, she contributed to the design and animation of several strategic workshops, including this one. This experience allowed her to strengthen her skills in facilitation, entrepreneurial support and innovation pathway structuring.

The workshop was also marked by the participation of **VINA**, represented by its founder **Anna**. This synergy between IKOLO and VINA perfectly illustrates the spirit of co-creation and entrepreneurial sisterhood that we defend: women leaders uniting to bring forth sustainable solutions adapted to local realities.

In continuation of this dynamic, IKOLO-VINA commits to promoting learning and collaboration spaces where women entrepreneurs can experiment, exchange and grow together.

3.title: KENGO KUMA DAY: A DAY DEDICATED TO THE FAMOUS JAPANESE ARCHITECT
3.excerpt: Exceptional event on June 24, 2025 to present the sustainable development project of the Ambalakalanoro site.
3.content:
**KENGO KUMA DAY: A DAY DEDICATED TO THE FAMOUS JAPANESE ARCHITECT KENGO KUMA**

Last June 24, 2025, Bois Vert Antananarivo hosted an exceptional event: Kengo Kuma Day, a day dedicated to the official presentation of the sustainable development project of the Ambalakalanoro site, in the presence of the famous Japanese architect Kengo Kuma. This highlight brought together embassy representatives, the Ministry of Tourism and Crafts, associations, private actors and environmental defenders, all mobilized around the same ambition: to lay the foundations for more virtuous tourism in Madagascar.

This project, carried by the NGO Man and Environment Madagascar and coordinated by Label CBD Consulting, once again brought together the two committed entrepreneurs: **Anna**, Founder of Vina Consulting and **Holy Rakotomalala**, founder of IKOLO.

ü§ù **Female coordination serving a shared vision**

**Anna** ensured the general co-coordination of the event with Label CBD, from logistics to communication, through team mobilization and supplier management. Her rigor and ability to federate allowed her to meet this challenge in record time.

**Holy**, for her part, took charge of technical coordination, VIP guest reception management and press relations. Her attention to detail, federative energy and expertise in event management largely contributed to the fluidity and visibility of this day.

üå± **Ambalakalanoro: a jewel to preserve**
The Ambalakalanoro site, carried by the NGO Man and Environment, was at the heart of discussions. A true biodiversity gem, it embodies the potential of responsible tourism, rooted in nature and respectful of local communities. Kengo Kuma Day initiated a collective reflection on its development, in connection with the principles of sustainability, bioclimatic architecture and valorization of Malagasy natural heritage.
